## R Markdown

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

```{r cars}
summary(cars)
```

## Including Plots

You can also embed plots, for example:

```{r pressure, echo=FALSE}
plot(pressure)
```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.


```{r}
# control option I is f=shortcut for R chunk
library(tidyverse)
survey <- read_csv('https://raw.githubusercontent.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/master/data/2021/2021-05-18/survey.csv')

#write_csv(survey,file="survey_data.csv")
write_csv(survey,"survey_data.csv")

survey%>%glimpse()
survey%>%skim()

library(skimr)

survey%>%glimpse()
survey%>%skim()

```

### Data Wrangling

#### Filter


```{r}
survey%>%
  filter(country=="Australia")



survey_IT_au<-survey%>%
  filter(country=="Australia" | country=="australia"|country=="Australi")%>%
  filter(industry=="Computing or Tech" & annual_salary>80000)

```

#### Select

```{r}
survey_IT_au %>%
  select(how_old_are_you, annual_salary)%>%
  arrange(annual_salary,)


survey_IT_au%>%
  select(-industry)
```
